subject: Art
title: Warm & Cool Colors
description: How temperature divides the wheel and affects mood and depth.

hook.text: Red, orange, yellow â€” you feel warmth just reading those words. Blue, green, violet â€” instant coolness. Color temperature is psychological, physical, and one of the most powerful tools in art.

buildup.text: Warm colors (red, orange, yellow) advance â€” they feel closer and more energetic. Cool colors (blue, green, violet) recede â€” they feel farther away and calmer.

discovery.text: Temperature is relative, not absolute. A blue-red is warm compared to blue-violet, but cool compared to orange-red. Every color is warm or cool only in comparison to its neighbors.

twist.text: In shadows, light is usually warm or cool â€” and the shadows are the opposite temperature. A warm sunny day has cool blue-purple shadows. An overcast cool day has warm brownish shadows.

climax.text: The Impressionists built entire paintings on warm-cool contrast: warm sunlit fields against cool purple shadows. The temperature contrast made their light glow.

punchline.text: Warm comes forward. Cool goes back. Temperature is depth and mood in one.

quiz.question: What do cool colors do in a composition?
options: They recede and feel farther away and calmer
